intro: Pulicaria glutinosa, commonly known as sticky groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features yellow flowers that bloom in early summer, arranged in clustered inflorescences. Its leaves are covered in a sticky, resinous substance, which gives it its common name. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands.
